title: We aims to reciprocate love Kerala bestowed on brand: Satyaki Ghosh
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Sep 23, 2022, 12:32 pm In an interview with MI , Satyaki Ghosh, CEO of Domestic Textiles (Grasim Industries) Aditya Birla Group speaks about the marketing innovations and brand strategy. Let’s read: Satyaki: It’s that time of the year eagerly anticipated by every Malayalee in God’s own country. Everyone is all set to celebrate Onam with full fervour this time round after two muted years filled with Covid restrictions and kickstart the festive calendar in India. The festival tends to be a barometer for consumer sentiments and spending, setting the stage for marketers’ frenzied bouts of promotional activities. Brands are rousing with innovative campaigns and product offers to match consumer sentiment and partake in festive celebrations. Linen Club, the pioneering linen brand from the Aditya Birla Group, unveiled a unique campaign called ‘Homecoming’ – a film and a beautiful Folk song to celebrate the biggest festival in the market. To mark the annual celebration of Onam. With this campaign, the brand aims to reciprocate the love Kerala has bestowed on the brand over the years. Satyaki: The campaign further brings alive the authentic aesthetics of the festival Onam & the expertise and expanse of Linen Club with a showcase of the broad palate of fabrics and apparel the brand offers. The song Thiruvonamullil Nirayenam is a unique endeavour by a fashion brand like us to present a local folk melody and join their customers as they celebrate their most important annual festival – Onam. Satyaki: Linen Club’s passion, authenticity, and expertise in creating the best linen fabrics and apparel are apparent in the campaign focused on Onam. It displays the variety and the robust portfolio of products the brand offers. Linen Club and Linen Club Studio offer premium linen fabrics and ready-to-wear apparel like shirts, jackets, trousers, kurtas, Mundus, etc., to match the festivity’s spirit. The concept of Fabrik Pookalam is exceptional and brings alive a beautiful harmony between the brand’s offerings and the festival’s nature. Satyaki: Ahead of Onam, as Kerela begins preparations, we are excited to demonstrate the broad palette of colours, categories, designs & textures we offer in pure Linen. Combined with consummate craftsmanship using cutting-edge European technology, we ensure best-in-class sustainable Linen products in both tailored and ready-to-wear categories. The driving factors of the brand’s advancement in the retail space are its unique combination of characteristics that it portrays, and the loyal consumer base it boosts off has helped the brands reach greater horizons. Satyaki: The campaign showcases a heartfelt homecoming of family and friends to their roots based on the age-old tale of King Mahabali and a celebration of the folk art forms of Kerala to bring in the new year. With Mala Parvathy and George Kora helming the beautiful video story, the TVC is produced to strike a chord instantly with the viewer. It signifies celebration and prosperity while evoking a sense of abundance. Satyaki: Brands play a pivotal role in creating a more equitable society at the grassroots level. To create awareness and acceptance of an inclusive community, brands need to work towards breaking down barriers and increasing access. The brand’s intent needs to be bonafide. Therefore, brands must introspect and re-evaluate whether the campaigns they build are truly symbolic of their core values and whether they are empowering the consumer. The way brands can inspire trust in their target audience is when they lead by example, and others follow suit, and this can be done with an honest, immersive 360-degree narrative enhancing the brand’s reputation. It should be more about participation, a celebration of being alive, being active, and being encouraged to be better. A brand is a direct manifestation of the values the company represents, and empathy and an ethical value system must lie at the core of those values. Your email address will not be published. title: Manoj Tulsani, CEO of Rayna Group
article_content: By MediaInfoline Oct 04, 2022, 17:03 pm Manoj: I am Manoj Tulsani , a travel entrepreneur and Rayna Tours and Travels co-founder and CEO. Starting more than a decade ago, Rayna Tours has been the industry’s number-one choice for destination management services. Our main office is in Dubai and has locations in several parts of the globe, including Malaysia, Singapore, India, Israel, and South Africa. We cater to B2C and B2B clients, with dedicated sections to combine all travel elements, such as worldwide hotel reservations, international visa services, high-end logistic packages, and all-inclusive holidays. Manoj: Rayna Tours began from a small outlet inside Flora Grand Hotel in Dubai. There were just two of us (KamleshRamchandani and I) to take care of every aspect of running and growing our venture back then. That was in 2006; about two years later, we opened 15 more similar outlets before reinforcing our status as a leading destination management company by 2009. Since then, Rayna Tours has remained one of the leaders in offering full-suite travel solutions to all travelers. Manoj: I have always been an avid traveler with an entrepreneurial spirit, so when I decided on a career change after working for about seven years in the trading industry, there wasn’t any confusion or difficulty in choosing my domain, i.e., tourism and hospitality. We started Rayna Tours and Traveled more to express ourselves and nurture our passion. Manoj: It’s exciting when you’re the in-charge of your own business. But there are a lot of obstacles and struggles behind this reality. It is especially dreadful in the early stage, at least for us, as we came from an entirely different industry and didn’t have solid strategies or the right team to back our business ideas. That said, it continues in every phase. The catch is removing the roadblock by learning from the mistakes, conducting extensive market research, and devising a tactical strategy. It not only helps us to know the dynamic travel trends and customer requirements but also sets concrete goals that deliver the expectations of our targeted and potential audience with an enriched customer experience. Manoj: Our ability to innovate as per the market demands is one of the critical factors that help us to stand out in the industry. We believe consistently delivering quality services is equally vital to retaining existing and attracting new customers. That’s why we don’t have a middleman for planning and implementing most of our services, mainly cruises, safaris, or premium sightseeing tours. No matter whether they are looking for pocket-friendly or uber-luxurious travel choices. Our objective is to serve all levels of travelers, so we offer products and services that satisfy every guest’s needs through our strong presence in both B2C (www.raynatours.com) and B2B ( www.raynab2b.com ) domains. Rayna Tours is staffed by some of the most brilliant and creative talents, instrumental in the company’s ongoing success. Himanshu Laul, a graduate of B.Arch. from IIT, Roorkee, is the Managing Director of Rayna Group. At the same time, Mr. Yasser Noman, with an experience of over three decades in the travel industry, is the company’s Executive Chairman. Manoj: Starting with just two of us, Rayna Tours and Travels now has a vibrant multicultural workforce of about 600 employees working in its diverse branches worldwide. We began humbly to arrange stress-free Dubai activities and tours for the hotel guests. Over the years, Rayna Tours has made a significant mark in the industry as one of the UAE’s top and favorite destination management service providers. It is now an award-winning company with many respected awards and recognitions to its credit, including Arabian Travel Awards for Best Destination Management Company and Best B2B Travel Portal and Travelers’ Choice Awards from TripAdvisor, a few. Manoj: We have some resourceful plans for Rayna Tours. As we currently have a presence in about ten countries, our primary goal is to get Rayna Tours and its exceptional offerings to more and more destinations worldwide until it becomes a highly successful global travel brand. title: Our platform promotes digital payments with cashless transactions: Amit
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Oct 10, 2022, 18:07 pm In an interview with MI, Amit Gupta, Founder, KMKD Rupay Bachao LLP speaks about inception and journey. Let’s read: Amit: Being a keen financial enthusiastic individual, I have always aspired to develop a cashless transaction system. To promote the cashless trading business in India, we have thoughtfully launched Rupay Bachao. It is an online platform for buyers and sellers to do trading without involving cash transactions. The formation of the Digital India Policy created the presence of trade platforms digitally and kicked me to start this idea. Rupay Bachao, with modern technology, created a reliable and robust trade platform where it is possible to do current barter transactions. Our platform allows trading activities between shopkeepers and businessmen to sell their goods and services in exchange for RFTs (Rupee Free Token). Registered members can use RFTs to buy or use other services without cash transactions. For the first time in India, such an application has been designed for a B2B business model where the registered members and their employees can buy and sell goods and services without involving cash. Since its inception in April 2022 with zero brand association, we have enrolled more than 500 brands, including Real Estate, Tourism and Travel Industry, Hospitality Sector, Advertising & Marketing, Interior & Décor, Food & Groceries, Construction Business, etc. Amit: Digital India is the new India! Govt has formed this vision to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy. To meet this objective, we created Rupay Bachao to make businesses more efficient. Our platform promotes digital payments through cashless transactions aligned with government digital India policy. In this digital era, we have thoughtfully created a fully secure and flexible way to allow members to increase their sales through applications and, at the same time, save cash outflow by sourcing their requirements from the members on the platform. Amit: One core objective of launching this platform is to utilize the capacity and incur more output from the same amount of input. And yes, we are one of the most secured apps which are cautious about data security systems as our complete data is encrypted. At Rupay Bachao, all the transactions are above the board. Every transaction between the members will be recorded in the books of account. Further, Rupay Bachao has a transparent data-sharing policy with the Indian Government/ taxation authorities. Thus, every sale on the platform is treated as income of the individual member and every purchase as his/her expenses under appropriate heads. Moreover, we have organized a procedure to check the authenticity of the owner and digital transaction, which involves a redirected SMS alert when a transaction occurs in any account, dual authentication for the login process, and a verified confirmation to initiate any transaction. Amit: Our modern tech generation has left traditional working patterns and adopted all digital means. From buying, selling, meeting, and learning, everything has turned digital, and so is trading. Digital trading has now taken up the stage by implementing cashless transactions. It also helps in authenticating and formalizing all transactions and restricts fraud. The cashless transaction has boosted the digital trading market and is considered a safer and more secure way of transferring money. Rupay Bachao has a similar vision of making trade businesses cashless and providing significant benefits to the members and industry. Your email address will not be published. Many factors have played a significant role in brand messaging during the last two years, and creativity has helped many brands sail through this phase. title: We’ve solved problem by re-imagining OTTs from ground up- Goutham
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Mar 28, 2023, 08:20 am MI speaks with Goutham Vinjamuri, COO and Co-Founder of Quickplay , in a detailed interaction. Let’s read: Goutham: Quite simply, we keep our eyes on the future. We’ve created a culture that fosters innovation, a willingness to explore the unknown, and a commitment to leadership in implementing new technologies. We’ve recognized that the future of OTT requires fast, flexible, scalable platforms that can help the industry adapt quickly to changes in technology and consumer behavior. Video delivery has evolved quickly from cable and broadcast to TV Everywhere and now to an OTT world that includes subscription services (SVOD), ad supported services (AVOD), free, ad supported television (FAST), pay-per-view and more. Historically, the industry needed to build separate infrastructures for each business model, hindering the ability to change and grow with the market. We’ve solved the problem by re-imagining the OTT platform from the ground up. We’ve created a video pipeline designed for high-quality, low-latency streaming at scale; a video CMS that enhances viewers’ discovery of content with relevant and personalized experiences; and ready-to-use applications across web, mobile, smart TVs, set-top-boxes, connected TVs, and gaming consoles that are designed to get our customers’ services in front of their subscribers in record time. Our cloud-native and cloud-agnostic platform harnesses cloud-native technologies –containers, microservices, a service mesh, APIs, and immutable infrastructure – to reduce the cost and effort of deployment by upwards of 40% or more . We have the flexibility to work as a standalone end-to-end solution or integrated with best of breed technology partners to deliver significantly better performance, a modular approach for feature expansion, continuous delivery for rapid iteration of new features and apps, and built-in scalability, observability and security – in short, a future-proof architecture that can pivot quickly when the need arises. Goutham: OTT subscribers often are attracted to a particular service because of a favorite show or series. They frequently will binge-watch that content during a free trial period, with the intention of terminating the subscription once they have finished – netting the OTT provider zero return. To build long term value, providers need their content to be part of the subscriber’s daily habit, as much as a morning coffee or an afternoon walk. Providers need to use data analytics to generate content recommendations, surface content that complements subscribers’ initial area of interest, and be ready to act quickly to save at-risk subscribers. Our platform includes in-house and third-party tools that touch each and every step of the subscriber lifestyle. Our data analytics capabilities enable levels of personalization that surpass traditional recommendations by finding the connections that can help subscribers uncover new viewing opportunities amidst the longtail content in providers’ libraries. Our award-winning personalized FAST channels are the “front porch” of content discovery, feeding subscribers a virtual linear stream that is targeted to their specific interests. We’re also created a fail-safe to reduce subscriber defections. Our customers have insight into “survival curves” that can forecast how long consumers are likely to stay on the service based on their subscription levels, previous renewal track-record, video watch patterns, and more – an early warning system that can help OTT providers prevent cancellations. Goutham: When consumers have access to at least one streaming service –as does 57% of the Indian market – recommending the right content at the right time is essential. At Quickplay, we’ve created an AI/ML based solution that can increase content reach and subscribers engagement and are harnessing Generative AI to personalize content promotion. When you step back and look at the OTT business in general, there are a number of insights that help to shape providers’ decisions. In the SVOD business, for example, approximately 20% of the content catalog contributes to 80% of total watch time. And 80% of OTT playback comes from the top four carousels on the home screen. We help our customers take their subscribers more deeply into their content catalogues. Our AI-powered content metadata engages the subscriber with granular content discovery experiences by analyzing the video scenes and the closed-captions available within the content and uncovering microgenres and plot keywords. Our hyper-personalized recommendation engine considers the subscriber’s behavioral data, their watch patterns, and AI-powered content metadata to generate recommendations that expedite content discoverability. And our algorithms measure subscriber engagement, propensity to subscribe/winback, churn predictions, and personalized ads to model customer behaviour and create cohorts for targeted marketing and acquisitions. At the NAB Show this year, we’ll be showing how multimodal Generative AI is transforming the ability of content providers to personalize on-screen posters – one of the entry points to video discovery. Using Generative AI’s ability to recognize actors, landmarks, genres, content and service providers can automatically design posters that are targeted to every individual viewer, based on existing viewer behavior and preferences. This is just the latest way in which we are harnessing AI to help the streaming industry achieve new levels of success. Goutham: First, Quickplay’s cloud-native platform is cloud agnostic. OTT providers don’t need to make a platform decision based on a specific cloud provider. Instead, we can work with THEIR cloud of choice – public cloud, in-country cloud or telco cloud – removing a not-insignificant obstacle to deployment. Second, we’re expert at helping customers who were locked into premise-based or hybrid solutions to escape those confines and build fast, flexible services that reduce upfront costs and enable auto-scaling in alignment with subscriber growth. Throughout our history we’ve taken on challenging use cases in challenging operating environments and have made them look easy. We have a track record here supporting more than 50 of the world’s biggest media brands. Finally, our cloud versatility offers the added benefit of enabling OTT providers to use their existing cloud spending commitments on the Quickplay platform. This helps them achieve greater business efficiency. One last thing: We have a superb and recognized track record of working with cloud providers. Quickplay last year was the Google Cloud Industry Solutions Partner of the Year and Microsoft Cloud Partner of the Year finalist. Goutham: There no single consensus on how high global OTT revenue will be in coming years, but all sources unanimously point to continued rapid growth. According to Digital TV Research, the total OTT market was projected to be USD $157 billion at the end of 2022, $174 billion by the end of this year and $243 billion by 2028. One of the trends we are seeing is the rise of advertising supported services as households better manage the number of subscriptions to which they committed during pandemic quarantines. AVOD revenue growth is expected to outpace SVOD growth by more than 40% between now and 2028, says Digital TV Research. What this means for the industry is that there will be an increased need for technologies available that will help providers harness that growth and quickly enable new opportunities to engage and monetize audiences. We’re seeing an interest across the industry in replacing legacy platforms that limited providers’ growth – restricting scalability, implementation of new features, and launches of new monetization strategies. We see many of these customers now rethinking those choices and evaluating cloud-native platforms such as ours that can deliver the flexibility, the agility, and the scalability they need to achieve their objectives. As the industry pivots from SVOD (Subscription VOD) to AVOD (Ad-Supported VOD) and FAST (Free Ad-Supported Television), providers are looking at ways to create a new generation of ad-supported services that drive subscriber satisfaction and monetization through better personalization and targeting. Goutham: The aha story is amazing – a classic example of how technical and business innovation can combine to achieve spectacular results. aha came to us in 2021 as they were revamping their “glocal” strategy for what was at the time a service focused entirely on the Telugu market. Within six months of reaching an agreement we had helped to migrate that groundbreaking Telugu service to a new cloud-native platform, providing the flexibility and scale aha demanded; just three months into the migration, Quickplay enabled aha to launch in Tamil using the same backend. aha came into the project with high expectations; our cloud-native architecture proved that it was flexible, agile, and scalable enough to meet those ambitious cost, time-to-market, and subscriber growth objectives. We helped aha achieve a 5x increase in user engagement and watch duration via the following: aha 2.0 really has been a technology, business and market triumph that is being judged as equal or superior to major global brands. The results have been phenomenal because of its 100% regional and hyper-local strategies. Coming to market in a record time frame, the cloud-based platform today supports >10 devices, dozens of new integrations to help capture data and run operations efficiently, and gateways for payments around the globe. Currently, more than 50 million unique users have visited and upwards of 18 million mobile app downloads. International subscribership has risen by 60% since the launch of aha 2.0, and paid subscribership has increased to nearly 2 million. We recently introduced free games, are adding more innovative features, and are working with aha on expansion to new markets. One last thing: When aha and Disney+ Hotstar simultaneously aired the Indian blockbuster “Bheemla Nayak” earlier this year, aha 2.0 earned rave reviews for its performance. Viewers tweeted lavish praise for aha’s Dolby 5.1 audio and 4K HD video quality and in an informal online poll more than 62% of viewers selected aha’s telecast as the superior experience. By any measure, that’s success! In another landmark achievement, aha, one of India’s leading regional OTT, has won the Internet & Mobile Association of India’s (IAMAI) India Digital Awards 2023 ‘Best Entertainment App’ Award under the category Best Mobile & App Awards. Goutham: Last year was a banner year for Quickplay’s association with Google Cloud. We were named the Google Cloud’s Media & Entertainment Industry Partner of the Year and collaborated closely with Google Cloud on a number of streaming innovations built on existing Google Cloud products. We announced the relationship about a year ago and followed up in August with news of collaboration in three specific areas.: o Personalized FAST channels running on Google Cloud and ready for scalable CTV monetization via pre-integration with Google Ad Manager across client, and server side environments. o Analytics dashboards built on a proprietary, unified data model, bringing together user engagement, content performance, and quality of experience metrics to help drive the business. Leveraging the Quickplay analytics platform, built on top of Google BigQuery and Looker, media companies can identify and target users at risk of churn to improve retention and identify new revenue opportunities. o Linear streaming through HLS and DASH on Google Cloud Media CDN, with an early version of low latency streaming using the LL-DASH protocol. It’s also important to note that we’ve pre-integrated Google Ad Manager’s digital ad management capabilities into our next-generation OTT streaming platform. The goal is bring together the diverse ecosystems of streaming providers, CTV platform owners and advertisers – all in the name of expediting monetization. Because the integration covers both client-side and server-side ad insertion use cases for HLS and DASH delivery protocols, we can more efficiently power providers’ AVOD, linear and FAST services, using the same backend platform, across all CTV platforms. In addition, our Quickplay personalization capabilities can enable better, more intelligent experiences that engage audiences with relevant content and advertising, including personalized FAST channel. Ultimately our pre-integrated solution means that current and prospective CTV partners can utilize Google Ad Manager to power monetization by tapping into diverse content sources supported on Quickplay’s platform. title: Pandemic brought up the forefront of importance of hygiene: Shruti Kapoor
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Apr 11, 2023, 09:55 am MI speaks with Shruti Kapoor, Senior Manager – Marketing, Soothe Healthcare . Shruti underlines the brand’s idea behind the campaign and their other initiatives. Excerpts here: Shruti: The Champion for Champions is more than a campaign for us; like an initiative. It’s not a recent campaign. We started it almost two years back during the pandemic. At that time, we associated with 20,000 female police officers. The thought behind this was to celebrate these women and their contribution who works tirelessly for society. These real-life champions who have a lot of potential need a little support. This collaboration was to highlight the importance of menstrual hygiene. This year, we were approached by sporting ethos. As a brand, Paree believes in supporting young girls in sports. These sports are not regular, but very niche, like para-athlete, rugby, rifle shooting, and more. We were very inspired by these girls and wanted to support these champions. And Paree as a brand proposition has been a heavy flow champion. So we thought to be the champion behind these real-life champions. Shruti: Paree has always supported female sports persons. We had associated with Badminton star, Saina Nehwal in the past. And she is still associated with Paree. This time we wanted to highlight niche sports; not regular sports like cricket, badminton, and tennis. Because it is important for people to know about other sports as well, there are a lot of representation. The payers put in their hard work and grit to make their way for the particular sport. So it’s important for us that these players get support from us. Shruti: I really hope so. But these changes would happen at a societal level which is relatively slow. In India, we have treated menstruation as a topic that is talked about in a hushed tone. I think it will slowly lead to a shift with the government aiding in openly talking about it. Our honorable Prime Minister, a couple of years back, in his Independence Day speech addressed the issue and pleaded with women to prioritize their menstrual health. In cinema halls also, there are government ads on menstrual wellness. Various brands are now talking openly about the importance of menstrual hygiene. Currently, a majority of women, don’t have access to menstrual hygiene. This is where all of ours, as an industry effort comes into play. The more we talk about it, the better awareness it creates. It is an important subject right now, as 23% of our girls drop out of school once they start menstruating. Mostly because they don’t have facilities available for them, families make these girls leave the schools. It is unfortunate, and it’s really a cost of opportunity here. If women must be a part of society, the shift needs to happen where we talk about menstruation openly. Shruti: Absolutely. The more men become a part of the larger conversation about menstrual health, the more normalized it will become in society. We had an interesting campaign that we did on Valentine’s Day. We asked men to show their women Paree walla care . Every couple celebrates Valentine’s Day with roses and chocolates. But do they know their partner’s period date, or do they pamper them on those days? The idea was to make men understand that real love is when you show your partner when she needs it. And if your woman is comfortable talking about menstruation and all about it with you. Shruti: There’s another initiative that we have launched named PareeVartan. It’s about raising awareness, creating impact, and then empowering women. These are the three pillars on which PareeVartan was based. Under this initiative, we have visited different schools and colleges where we take menstrual hygiene sessions. These sessions are about using sanitary pads and menstrual hygiene correctly. We especially target government and underdeveloped schools in different parts of the country. These girls need much more education about menstrual hygiene. We just don’t distribute pads in these places, but we also provide them with proper sessions. These sessions are conducted by our in-house menstrual hygiene experts, who are certified to take these sessions. Last year in December, we adopted 100 schools in Bihar. The objective is to take care of the girls’ menstrual hygiene in those schools. This initiative has become big now, and we have expanded in UP, MP, and Rajasthan. Another initiative was the collaboration with Dr. Kiran Bedi’s foundation, India Vision Foundation. Here we took menstrual hygiene sessions in the female presence after every quarter. We also provide sanitary pads here. The idea is to take it to the grassroots level because that’s where the real change and impacts are going to come around. Shruti: We have our on-ground sales team. They get us in touch with schools in some villages or outskirts of a city. We distribute sanitary pads and keep enough of them in the school so the girls can use them for the next 3-4 months. Then we provide proper sessions also. Shruti: In India, only 20% of the females use sanitary pads, whereas the rest don’t even have access to it. Women are still using unhygienic means like clothes or in some cases, leaves. India is the cervical cancer capital of the world. So, yes, it is essential to maintain a lesser carbon footprint and pads are non-biodegradable products. But at the same time, we need to understand that a sanitary pad is something that a woman needs to live her life normally. Why do we expect only women to suffer because sanitary pads are contributing to carbon footprint? While we can work towards other options which are bio-degradable like menstrual cups. At the same time, just think about a woman who never even used a pad, will she be able to use a menstrual cup? Different cultural biases come against menstrual cups. In some cases, women tell us if the woman can still be a virgin because they think only married women can use menstrual cups. In fact, there are a lot of things that are worse than a pad and creating humongous carbon footprints. Sanitary pads are just for five days a month for a woman, but it impacts her entire life. So I think we should give her access to sanitary pads first, then later as she grows with it she can switch or decide on bio-degradable options. We have been continuously doing our part to lessen the carbon footprint with our research and development happening at our end. We have menstrual cups as well. We are even working on the clean disposal of sanitary pads. We have been responsibly disposing of 50 metric tons of this waste. We have been recognized by the government also for doing so. Shruti: The pandemic has impacted the category as a whole in a good way. The pandemic brought up the forefront of importance of hygiene. Even if we had the knowledge, how actively we do things we have been taught or learned. Women started taking care of themselves, taking note of how to keep menstrual hygiene, and how to responsibly dispose of it. So the industry is growing while the focus is on hygiene. Shruti: As a brand, we always wanted to be present where our audience lies. We have always believed in 360-degree marketing. In this way, we can build brand awareness and, at the same time, reinforce what the brand stands for. We have a lot of younger audiences who have moved largely on to digital. We are a part of digital media to talk to our audience. Because digital is the only medium that is two-way communication, especially social media. We can engage with our audience. We have now started going to new-age digital platforms like Sharechat and Moj. Here we can talk to our consumers in the language that they want. Last year, we did a campaign in Sharechat where we communicated our brand with small influencers in Bhojpuri and Hindi. We received an amazing response from them. For our Champion for Champions campaign, Janhvi Kapoor, our brand ambassador posted a video because she was very excited about the association with athletes. After that, we heard a lot of conversations about it. Shruti: The organization is growing exponentially. Paree is now a 100 crore brand. The organization, Soothe Healthcare, is now a 250 crore brand. We have crossed 200 crores in a short span of time. So the plans for the future are exciting, but I can’t give you the details right now. We have a good product and a good face as a brand ambassador, a youth icon, Janhvi Kapoor. We also have a good media presence. So we are very excited about our future plans. Shruti: Live your life without holding back. Be true to yourself and always work towards achieving your dreams. As a woman, if we set our eyes on the goal, we are very dedicated. So, just walk towards it and make your dreams come true. Your email address will not be published. title: Guest Talk with Pawan Sarda, CGO, The House of Abhinandan Lodha
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari May 05, 2023, 10:02 am In an interview, MI talks with Pawan Sarda, Chief Growth Officer, The House of Abhinandan Lodha . “The brand will soon have a limited plot launch in Goa after the success of the last one.” He says. Let’s read: Pawan: Back in 2021, amidst lockdown, Mr. Abhinandan Lodha wanted to bring back the oldest asset class ‘land’ at the forefront & make it accessible to every Indian to make it part of their investment portfolio. Land buying has always had a traditional journey of buying in the region of familiarity & through word of mouth. It is not unknown that land as an asset class has always seen the highest appreciation among other instruments. However, people have not been able to identify the safest & most secure way to invest in land & this led to a new category, ‘Branded land.’ A branded land developer undertakes the massive responsibility of performing required legal checks, validating ownership status, and generally ensuring that the land is conflict-free and approved for sale. Furthermore, branded lands are usually in an area that will be urbanized or aggressively developed. This means there is a guarantee that the value of the land will exponentially increase with time and development around the area. But the paramount reason why people prefer investing in branded lands is that the developer guarantees security, trust, and transparency. These reasons cumulatively benefit the purchaser and make the entire process of owning land a nuisance free and a smart asset class. Considering this, we launched a project in Dapoli ‘Isle of Bliss’. With the vision to democratize land ownership to every Indian, the plots in these projects were priced starting Rs. 15 Lacs. The overwhelming response from the customers made the belief in the vision even stronger. This gave a boost to an accelerated journey in the last year with many successful launches. Thus far, the brand has sold more than 5 million sq.ft of land. Pawan: The House of Abhinandan Lodha is the only PAN India branded land developer having projects across locations. We are on a mission to make land buying accessible to all sitting from the comfort of their home. Purchasing branded land ensures the purchaser has secured land that is truly theirs and that the land’s value will increase in times to come. With the usage of DigiTech we are disrupting the category. With the promise of secure ownership, transparent process & documentation & backed with data on appreciation to build intergenerational wealth, we are turning on the head of this category for all the red tapeism that it is otherwise known for. The use of technology & the recent soft launch of the app, which can help you buy land in just 3 clicks, are steps taken to stay ahead of the curve. Pawan: Anyone who is looking to make a long term investment in assets & create intergenerational wealth is our customer. Whether it is a salaried person or a businessman, or an NRI. Our customers are not only across the country but globally. The brand largely uses the might of digital, channel partners & ATL activations to reach their base. Referral & loyalty is also part of our acquisition mix. Pawan: After the success of our past projects in Dapoli (Isle of Bliss, Cape of Bliss), Goa, Alibaug, and Anjarle (TomorroWorld & TomorrowLand) , the brand is launching a unique land parcel in Anjarle under the project name ‘TomorrowView.’ Staying true to its name, the plots in this land parcel will have an unobstructed ocean view; the land contour is such that it will provide a panoramic theatre-like ocean view to the customers. Anjarle is India’s fastest-growing tourist destination & is touted to be the Goa of tomorrow. Investment in this project is expected to fetch 5X returns in 10 years. Also, the brand will soon have a limited plot launch in Goa after the success of the last one. Pawan: Technology has revolutionized how real estate transactions are conducted and brought transparency, speed and efficiency in the sector. From enabling virtual reality tours to executing the use of artificial intelligence in booking, registration and documentation processes, technology has ensured the industry is a click away for consumers. Direct-to-consumer channels like apps and websites allow real-estate players to bring experiential solutions like virtual reality and 3D tours to the comfort and convenience of the consumer wherever they are. Combined with videoconferencing, which itself got a boost during Covid, it allows the real-estate industry to disrupt the site visit routine. This has transformed the way properties are marketed and sold. Buyers can now take a virtual tour of a property and get a realistic sense of what a property looks and feels like, all the while conversing with the expert without having to physically visit it. These new channels and technologies have revolutionized the way people shop for properties and make it easier for developers to showcase their inventory to potential buyers. The House of Abhinandan Lodha is giving the control back to customers with the launch of its app which will enable customers to purchase land online, view the entire documentation of their land investments, make timely milestone payments online & keep abreast with all the progress in their investment. This is one of its kind app in the industry today. Your email address will not be published. title: Zoher Kapuswala, Marketing Head, India- Tic Tac, Rocher, Nutella
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Jun 16, 2023, 10:01 am As the Marketing Head of Tic Tac in India, Zoher Kapuswala has been integral to the brand’s journey. He has spearheaded several successful campaigns that have helped Tic Tac grow year after year and establish itself as a market leader in the confectionery segment. The brand recently collaborated with Internet sensation Yashraj Mukhate for its latest digital campaign #TicTacLife. MI speaks with Zoher Kapuswala about the journey of the brand in India and its key focus markets. Let’s read… Zoher: Tic Tac was one of the Pioneers in Preimmunizing the India Confectionery Category by creating an INR 10 price point in the market, thanks to its first-of-its-kind share-worthy format. Ever since the Brand has evolved over the years, along with the changing consumer needs. Innovation has been at the heart of the Brand. It has been one of the first brands to launch traditional Indian flavors like Fennel. Tic Tac also launched a sub-brand Tic Tac Seeds, with crushed seeds inside, that epitomizes the Indian refreshment rituals, apart from the global leading flavors like Mint, Orange, and Red Apple. The Brand also ensures it stands out in the Impulse environment, by its innovative Shelf-ready packaging (like the Iconic Tree & the Wall-Hangers). Overall, Tic Tac’s journey in India has been one of innovation and adaptation. The brand has successfully carved out a unique space in the Indian market by positioning itself as a fun, refreshing mint that appeals to the youth. With its continued focus on product innovation and targeted marketing campaigns, Tic Tac is well-positioned to continue growing its market share in India. Zoher: Tic Tac has always been focused on product innovation by introducing new flavors and formats. This has helped the brand stay relevant and cater to changing consumer preferences. We, as a brand, built a strong brand image through consistent branding and advertising. The brand has a unique identity that is instantly recognizable and memorable. We have successfully reached out to our target audience through targeted marketing campaigns. The brand has leveraged social media and other digital platforms to engage with its consumers and build a stronger online narrative. We have built a strong distribution network that ensures the products are widely available across different channels and locations. This has helped the brand to reach a larger consumer base and gain a competitive advantage. Zoher: In 2022, Tic Tac’s ‘Mouth Fresh, Mood Refresh’ campaign was launched in India and aimed to position the brand as a mouth freshener that refreshes the mood by providing a continuous release of long-lasting and refreshing experiences. The campaign included a series of TV and digital ads that helped deliver the brand’s positioning among youngsters. Tic Tac recently collaborated with Yashraj Mukhate for its digital campaign #TicTacLife. The idea behind the campaign was to tap into the current trend of user-generated content and leverage the creative talent of Yashraj Mukhate to create an entertaining and engaging jingle featuring Tic Tac through an influencer marketing campaign. The campaign aimed to portray Tic Tac as an inspiration for a refreshing transformation that brings alive the precious moments of fun and good vibes to further establish Tic Tac as the preferred refreshment amongst the youth of India. Overall, Tic Tac has launched several innovative brand campaigns in India that have helped to drive its brand narrative and engage with its target audience. These campaigns have been creative, quirky, and fun, which resonates well with the brand’s image as a refreshing and enjoyable mint. Zoher: One of our key priorities is to expand our brand presence in India’s Tier 2 and 3 cities. To achieve this, we have implemented several initiatives specifically designed to cater to consumers’ needs and preferences in these markets. For example, we have recently done an on-ground “Fresh and Crazy”(College Fresher’s day) activation in 64 colleges in 8 cities of UP, which is the biggest Indian state in terms of population and presents big business opportunities for Tic Tac. This was clubbed with a store seeding van activation, which helped us open new stores and increase our distribution and engagement with consumers and shoppers in small towns of UP. These activations helped us in increasing mental and physical availability among our target audience which is the young college students. We have also partnered with local distributors and retailers to ensure that our products are widely available in these markets. We have also introduced smaller pack sizes and more affordable prices to make our products accessible to a wider range of consumers. We have conducted extensive research to understand consumers’ unique needs and preferences in Tier 2 and 3 cities and have developed campaigns that resonate with them. Overall, our approach to expanding our brand presence in Tier 2 and 3 cities has been one of localization and personalized engagement. By understanding consumers’ unique needs and preferences in these markets and tailoring our strategies accordingly, we are confident that we can continue growing our brand presence and building a loyal customer base. Zoher: Our key focus markets are primarily the urban and semi-urban areas of the country. We have identified these markets as having high potential for growth due to their large consumer base and increasing disposable income levels. To cater to these markets, Tic Tac has implemented a targeted marketing strategy that focuses on reaching consumers in these areas through various channels. This includes leveraging social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube to engage with our target audience and promote our products. We have also established a strong distribution network in these markets, ensuring that our products are widely available in convenience stores, supermarkets, and other retail outlets. Additionally, we have partnered with popular e-commerce platforms such as Amazon and Flipkart to reach consumers who prefer to shop online. In terms of product offerings, we have introduced channel specific SKUs and specialized combi packs specifically tailored to the tastes and preferences of consumers in these markets. In short, an always on the go approach and innovative thinking have helped drive growth and maintain our position as a leading confectionery brand in India. Zoher: Constant product innovation coupled with varied marketing strategies has helped us achieve year on year brand growth in the India market. Tic Tac has continuously introduced new flavors and product variants, such as Tic Tac Spearmint and Tic Tac Seeds respectively, to cater to changing consumer palate. This has helped to keep the brand relevant and drive sales growth. We as a brand, have consistently implemented effective marketing strategies that have helped to build brand awareness and drive consumer engagement. The brand has leveraged various marketing channels, including social media and influencer marketing, to reach its target audience and promote its products. Tic Tac has also come up with some innovative in & out flavors like Popcorn, Cherry Cola and Banana in India to drive brand growth, that offered something new and unique to the consumers. Some other factors for year-on-year brand growth in the Indian market can be attributed to a combination of strong distribution network, and a focus on quality and consistency, by continuing to focus on these key areas, Tic Tac is well-positioned to sustain its growth in the Indian market. title: Lt. Gen. Dr Vimal Arora, Chief Clinical Officer at Clove Dental Care
article_content: By MediaInfoline Oct 16, 2023, 09:17 am Here’s the guest talk with Clove Dental: Dr Vimal: Well! The journey undertaken by me in Clove Dental 8 years back has been spectacular, highly fulfilling and really enjoyable. I feel proud of the way Clove Dental has transformed the lives of thousands of dentists and at the same time provided an ethical treatment to millions of patients over the last 12 years. It has been enjoyable to see the metamorphosis that Clove Dental went through. From 20+ clinics when I joined to its present mammoth of more than 400+ clinics in 24 cities across India. There is no doubt that it was an uphill task but with the support of our CEO Mr. Amar Singh, the journey became a never ending story of dreams coming true. We could change how dentistry was practiced in all neighborhoods with our impeccable SOPs and standards in sterilization, asepsis, record keeping and patient care services. In the process of following us, our neighborhood dentists also underwent a change for the better. Clove Dental now sets standards for most other clinics to follow and thus changing the landscape of dentistry. Also we could bring a change in the way dental surgeons were being treated and in the absence of jobs, many private practitioners were fleecing young dentists. We provided them the respect, dignity and a place to practice their profession at a decent salary. We provide them with an opportunity to learn and improve their skills for a better future. This feeling of helping my professional juniors has been the most fulfilling one. Dr Vimal: The healthcare industry, particularly oral healthcare, holds immense potential for business growth while simultaneously addressing the critical need for maintaining overall health. Oral health is gaining recognition as a fundamental aspect of well-being, and Clove Dental is at the forefront of this movement. Dentistry is serving its golden period at this time especially with the advent of new age materials and most recent cutting edge technology, which is changing the way dentistry has been practiced for the past 100 years. Last 4-5 years have brought in unimaginable technology in the hands of dentists for patients’ benefits. However, the challenge is being faced for delivery of treatments. The primary obstacle is the lack of awareness among the general population about the importance of oral health. This is the single most important factor of Oral Health and unfortunately our regulatory bodies have no focus on this. Most dental clinics suffer from inadequate infrastructure, subpar sterilization practices, poor quality services, lack of transparency, and safety concerns. Clove Dental aims to address these challenges by setting higher standards for ethical treatment and service quality. Dr Vimal: Clove Dental sets itself apart from competitors through a commitment to ethical treatment. The company does not overcharge patients and ensures that treatments are only recommended when necessary. It employs dedicated dental professionals who prioritize patient well-being. All dentists at Clove Dental are accredited and specialize in their respective fields. For instance, only experienced endodontists perform root canals, and implant procedures are carried out by dentists who have massive implant experience. The clinics are equipped with state-of-the-art technology and prioritize sterilization and asepsis. The introduction of AI-enabled chairside assistance and a patient care team available on call further enhances the patient experience. Dr Vimal: When the incidence of dental diseases in our country is as high as 85-87%, endless opportunities present themselves and the dentist who has vision will benefit from this. Along with growing awareness of oral health as an integral part of overall well-being, there is also innovation in dental technology and treatment methods. Compounding this issue, India has the lowest percentage of people who seek dental treatment themselves. If we rightly understand these two equations, we will also be clear about our priorities for the future. Dr Vimal: Clove Dental’s future plans are ambitious and visionary. The company aims to expand its presence even further by launching 1000+ clinics across India. This expansion will enable Clove Dental to provide affordable and high-quality dental treatment to a broader population, ensuring that oral healthcare is accessible to everyone. The company’s commitment to ethical practices, advanced technology, and patient-centric care will continue to be central to its mission and vision for the future. title: Harshna Pasari, Head of Marketing, Bluestone
article_content: By Choudhury Rajeshwari Oct 18, 2023, 18:12 pm Celebrating 12 years anniversary, Harshna Pasari, Head of Marketing, BlueStone speaks with MI about their inception and learning over the years. At BlueStone, she caters to evolving consumer preferences through end-to-end brand and marketing strategy. She talks about the recent trends in the industry and campaigns planned for the year. Excerpts here: Harshna: In 2011, BlueStone was launched as an online brand with the idea of reaching customers who browse information, and trending products, and ultimately make purchases from different categories of jewelry. We wanted to understand consumers with this online data available to us. The move towards online retailing was also fresh for consumers because, till now, the jewelry industry was stuck in offline stores, where there is not much scope for research. Consumers in a brick-and-mortar store find it challenging to search for one’s own style or understand more about the prices of the product or brand without having stress over the timeline. Another issue that offline retail stores face is having limited inventory as compared to online platforms. Gradually, despite having a good online presence, we realized that we must be an omnichannel platform in the jewelry industry. It is because consumers are present in every channel, and we want to expand our reach to tap into every consumer base. So we opened our first store in 2018 without looking back. Today, we are 180 plus stores and still growing. Another thing we realized is that the industry always shows the occasion-based and heavy jewelry. But consumers nowadays have changed and don’t like these heavy pieces. Customers want trending and lightweight pieces that they can wear from a coffee to a party. Women have many other occasions to step out and flaunt their style and wealth. So the journey is ever-evolving for BlueStone, understanding more about consumers using our technology and wishing to serve the perfect product to each customer. Harshna: The retail footfall is showing an upward trend for us. In the financial year 2022, we had approximately 80 stores, which grew voraciously to 180 plus stores. Our walk-in store is also seeing an increase. Because consumers want to experience products, this category especially has an added layer of higher involvement. Also, more physical stores lead to more trusted consumer relationships. We also have a Try at Home service, which caters to the needs of the consumers today. People want to experience the product from their home or office convenience. Today, we are present with Try at Home across more than 80 cities and it is growing. Harshna: Traditionally, the jewelry industry was all local brands. People had visited the stores that used to be there for generations. Gradually, there came the brands that have a presence pan India. It created a trusted relationship with the customers. It led to people preferring these certified brands. We at BlueStone believe that our designs and the quality of our products are what consumers love and trust. Yes, there’s competition, but still, our products speak for themselves with volumes, and it’s the reason consumers love us and time again visit us. Harshna: No, it’s not. Having said that, real gold, diamond, and gemstone jewelry, are something that teenagers or adolescents can’t afford unless their parents are buying for them. So our TG mostly looks 25 to 50 years old, with people who prefer modern designs. Primarily, this modern jewelry is an indulgence and not a need. People want to purchase them because they want to flaunt their wealth, or portray their statement of personal style. Harshna: I already talked about some of the changes, with light jewelry replacing heavy pieces, which are perfectly wearable for all occasions. Second, the trend of buying gold jewelry for investment purposes has also changed. People are willing to buy more diamond and gemstone studded jewelry, because they’re modern and young. People also love different enamel and ceramic jewelry. Third, multivariability and layering are also in trend among women. They want stackable rings and layered necklaces. So they can add layers whenever they wish to dress heavily for a party or occasion. Fourth is a product that we introduced as a category called watch jewelry. As per our research, most modern women are using smartwatches. So, we decided to accentuate that with our fine jewelry. That is the watch jewelry. We have sub-categorized it to smartwatch pins, bands, and charms, which people can cling to the smartwatch. These are available in gold, diamond, gemstone, and enamel. Fifth, we have seen men’s jewelry being revisited. Traditionally, men used to wear jewelry. But in the last few decades, it was almost lost. The jewelry industry was all about women. But now, we see men also welcome fine jewelry as a statement of their style, which is growing for us. Harshna: The Big Gold Upgrade is quite an exciting and unique proposition. So, based on our consumer’s choices, we realized people don’t want to keep their jewelry in the lockers and want to add value to their old gold pieces. However, they don’t want to sell the jewelry because of its emotional value. We wanted to give our customers a relief and solution to this issue. The ‘old gold exchange’ was already present in the industry. But the problem attached to this is that they don’t get the correct value for their old gold. So, our idea was to give a higher value because we wanted to build that trust by understanding or evaluating their old jewelry with their emotional values. For instance, if you give 8 grams of 18 karat gold, BlueStone will give you 8 grams of 22 karat gold. It acts as an upgrade and not just an exchange. With this higher value, you can further purchase anything from BlueStone. The campaign helped us increase the sales in respect of getting new customers and returning ones. Though not a new phenomenon, getting a higher value to their existing old gold encourages customers to try this offer. Harshna: For the jewelry industry, the festive season is the biggest. Culturally, Indians purchase gold jewelry during the festivals, for it’s considered auspicious. We still believe this. So, we at BlueStone are also geared up for the season. Looking at the last few year’s trends, we are expecting higher sales compared to 2022. Last year, people were making purchases of diamond studded jewellery. Hence, this year, we have more diamond studded collections, newer products, and overall collections. The Big Gold Upgrade will continue to be a great offer for the season. Apart from that, we are geared up across 180 plus stores. Harshna: Not exactly! Primarily, brands offering heavy jewelry for occasions and parties are the ones that are affected by inflation. For example, people planning a wedding will cut their heavy jewelry expenditures to lighter ones during the inflation. Sometimes, they reduce the number of pieces they want to buy during inflation. But our pieces are lightweight, which is suitable for everyday wear. It is not always a planned decision and is more like an indulging one. Luckily, we don’t get affected by inflation. Harshna: Our focus will be on our recently launched, Big Gold Upgrade campaign which we consider to have a huge potential. We want to increase the reach of the campaign. We want people to know more about the campaign and upgrade their style. From a product collection point of view, we are looking at many new diamond products and diamond studded gold jewellery. title: Excitement high among cricket enthusiasts this IPL : Ipsos IndiaBus
article_content: By MediaInfoline Apr 16, 2024, 10:07 am With the Tata Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 extravaganza off to a flying start from March 22nd 2024, an Ipsos IndiaBus pan India IPL Survey shows at least 1 in 2 urban Indians polled (53%) claim to be following the sporting event. Men’s T-20 annual sporting event in its 17th year, has a run of about 60 days, making it a highly engaging event for cricket lovers. Interestingly, more males (67%) claimed to be following the event vis-à-vis females (38%). Though there was not much difference seen across age bands and their interest in the game – 18-30 years (56%), 31-45 years (56%) and 45+ (45%) claimed to be following the IPL. Excitement with IPL The IPL has struck a chord with the cricket enthusiasts with 88% of those polled (and following the IPL) claiming to be excited about the annual sporting event. The excitement was palpable across demographics to the same extent, though among a few cohorts it was a lot higher, particularly the south zone (96%), north zone (93%), metros (91%), tier 2 (92%), tier 3 (95%), high education (92%), self-employed (95%) and 45+ age group (92%). Commenting on the findings of the Ipsos IndiaBus IPL Survey, Parijat Chakraborty, Group Service Line Leader Public Affairs, Corporate Reputation, CSR and ESG, Ipsos India said, “Tata IPL 2024 is this big, 60 day annual big treat for cricket enthusiasts, which has a heady mix of great batting and bowling order – also captured under orange and purple caps – best of cricket, world class players unleashing their prowess under pressure and the short format of cricket, creating a high level of engagement and excitement around this annual fiesta. The stakes are high, and this is one recession proof brand. As the event picks up, those following the game are likely to increase.” Where is the IPL being watched? Urban Indians who are extremely kicked about the sporting event claimed to be watching the IPL 2024 across different mediums of access – Television (75%), online/ mobile (49%), OTT platforms (20%) and radio (4%) . 33%). And if we explore deeper, while TV is the most popular medium for watching the game, more number of respondents from north zone (83%), full time parents and homemakers (84%), SEC B (80%), SEC A (78%), 45+ age group (86%), metros (79%), tier1 cities (79%) said they are watching the game on TV. Further, those watching the game on their mobile devices , were largely the self-employed (68%), employed – part time or full time (56%), males (57%), 31-45 years (54%), 18–30-year-olds (51%), high education (58%), living in the metros (56%), from south zone (56%) and west zone (55%). The game was being watched on OTT more by those belonging to SEC A (44%), metros (34%), high education (32%) and self-employed (33%). And those catching the game on the radio were largely the self-employed (9%), from tier 1 (9%), west zone (8%), SEC A (7%) and women (7%). Males were a miniscule 2%. The survey also explored the psyche of the IPL enthusiasts, to understand from them the motivations for liking the IPL so much. There is so much noise and chatter around this annual spectacle, which also packs in the best of breed and play in Cricket. Why is the IPL liked? Urban Indians claimed to be liking the IPL for a plethora of reasons – entertainment (64%), T-20 format (47%) and the team format – of world class players (37%). Audiences most kicked about the entertainment aspect were the self employed (76%), from east zone (74%), south zone (72%), SEC A (71%), SEC B (64%), men (64%), women (62%), aged 45+ (67%), 18-30 years (64%), 31-45 years (62%) etc. T-20 format was most liked by respondents from SEC A (65%), metros (75%), high education (58%), tier1 (52%), tier2 (50%), west zone (53%) and north zone (50%). And those most enthused about the T20 team format were, SEC A (54%), employed (47%), men (40%), high education (45%), tier 1 (52%), metros (42%), tier 2 (41%), east zone (53%) and west zone (45%). “When the IPL made its debut 17 years ago, conceived by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI), it was a big draw and it continues to be one of the most anticipated annual sporting events. This year there are 10 teams and 74 matches. Also the matches are aired from evening to night, over 3 hours, making it conducive for cricket enthusiasts to watch the game without disruption. With great cricket, cricket legends, Bollywood, music, cheerleaders and toots, the whole experience is now being called Cricketainment. And the BCCI has set up 50 fan parks in different cities of India, to enhance the whole experience for audiences, bringing the game closer to the fans. Fan parks during the weekends have giant size screens, music, subsidized food for cricket fans to enjoy the IPL at another level,“ added Chakraborty. “The 10 teams of Delhi Capitals, Kolkata knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants, Mumbai Indians, Rajasthan Royals, Chennai Super Kings, Gujarat Titans, Punjab Kings, Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Sunrise Hyderabad are playing 74 matches in 13 cities from March 22nd to May 26th, 2024, making it a visual treat for cricket crazy country like India. With defending champions Chennai Super Kings hosting the opening and closing ceremony, there is a keen interest among south zone fans for the game and across cities and cohorts. With free live streaming of the IPL on Star Sports (TV) and Jio Cinema (internet) it will be about excitement, entertainment and eyeballs, as the IPL keeps getting bigger,” stated Chakraborty. How is the IPL most watched? Urban Indians said they mostly watch the game with family (49%), friends (22%), alone (18%) or with colleagues (9%). The survey even drilled it down to the cohorts on how they were watching the IPL – those watching with family were largely full-time parents/ homemakers (75%), women (73%), 45+ age group (62%), SEC A (55%), SEC B (54%), north zone (58%), east zone (55%), tier 1 (55%) and metros (51%). Those watching with friends were particularly males (29%), SEC C (32%), south zone (41%), east zone (31%), tier 3 (33%), self-employed (32%) etc. Those watching alone were males (23%), aged 45+ (23%), employed (24%), tier 2 (26%), north (21%), south (20%) etc. Those watching with colleagues, aged 18-30 years (13%), students (14%), tier 1 (17%), west zone (15%), north zone (12%), et al. How we did it We ran the survey on Ipsos IndiaBus, our monthly pan India omnibus (which also runs multiple client surveys), using a structured questionnaire and is conducted by Ipsos India on diverse topics among 2200+ respondents from SEC A, B and C households, covering adults of both genders from all four zones in the country. The survey is conducted in metros, tier 1, tier 2 and tier 3 towns, providing a more robust and representative view of urban Indians. The respondents were polled face to face and online. We have city-level quota for each demographic segments that ensure the waves are identical and no additional sampling error. The data is weighted by demographics and city-class population to arrive at national average. Your email address will not be published. title: JioCinema Logs Over 71.5 Crore Views for the MI vs CSK Clash
article_content: By MediaInfoline Apr 16, 2024, 15:42 pm JioCinema logged over 71.5 Crore views for the marquee fixture between Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings on April 14th that was lit by MS Dhoni’s last over cameo and blistering ton by Rohit Sharma. The official streaming platform for the TATA IPL amassed 933 Crore minutes of watch time and 13 Crore viewers, bettering the reach of TATA IPL 2023 Final. JioCinema commenced the 2024 season with over 59 Crore views that led to 660 Crore minutes of watch-time on Day 1. After 29 matches, over 1200 Crore views and 14,800 Crore minutes of watch time were clocked from 38.3 Crore viewers on the platform, a 42% growth in viewers compared to the same period last season. The time spent per viewer per match on Connected TV (CTV) has crossed 80 minutes. JioCinema’s free-to-play predict and win game, Jeeto Dhan Dhana Dhan has enhanced the overall fan engagement efforts. The opening night contest saw Bhandup-based Antony D’Cruz winning gold worth INR 50 lakhs. Over 25 viewers from lengths and breadths of the country have won an elegant hatchback, motorcycle, and a smart TV, among many other prizes. JioCinema’s list of digital streaming sponsors for the 2024 TATA IPL season includes Dream11 as a co-presenting sponsor, while Tata Motors, PayZapp by HDFC Bank, SBI, Cred, AMFI, Upstox, Charged by Thums Up, Britannia, Pepsi, Parle products, Google Pixel, Haier, Jindal Steel, Vodafone, Dalmia Cements, Kamla Pasand, Rapido, MRF Tyres, RuPay and Jaguar Bath & Light, have joined hands as associate sponsors. Fans can watch the 2024 TATA IPL season in 4K, across 12 languages, including Haryanvi for the first time, with multi-cam options, including the much-loved Hero Cam. Viewers can also continue to watch their preferred sports by downloading JioCinema (iOS & Android). Your email address will not be published. title: Magnify to help Clubber TV for highlights capture in Hurling and
article_content: By MediaInfoline May 15, 2024, 12:17 pm Clubber TV, a leading platform for live and on-demand sports in Ireland, will be utilising Magnifi , an AI-powered highlight generation platform, for coverage of two of the nation’s most iconic sports. As part of this engagement, Clubber TV will use Magnifi to capture sport highlights, which will then be published to its social channels on Twitter/X, Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok. With Magnifi, Clubber TV can auto-generate clips for some of their key sports like Hurling/ Camogie and Gaelic football using sport-specific metatags. The AI-powered solutions by Magnifi can very efficiently be used with tags like “Puckouts won/lost” or “turnover” and auto-generate clips of those actions in Hurling/Camogie and Gaelic football respectively. Highlights are created much faster than the traditional method of sifting through footage and manually identifying and cutting highlights. This speed aligns with Clubber TV’s mandate as a platform for live and on-demand sports. “At Clubber TV, we already deliver the best live and on-demand sports to Irish fans, whenever and wherever they desire. With this in mind, it only makes sense for us to also prioritise speed and convenience when providing highlights from those games. With Magnifi, we can now publish highlights with the same level of efficiency,” said Jimmy Doyle, the founder and CEO of Clubber TV. While Magnifi already works with major teams, franchises, and leagues across the globe in sports like cricket, basketball, football, and baseball, its engagement with Clubber TV marks its first use case for Hurling/Camogie and Gaelic football, each of which is significant in its own right. These sports are deeply ingrained into Irish sporting culture. Hurling is one of the world’s oldest field games and its national championship in Ireland draws substantial crowds. Gaelic football, for its part, has competitions at the local, county, and national levels, and has gained traction in many other countries around the world through the Gaelic Athletic Association (GAA). “As sports deeply loved by Irish fans, Hurling/Camogie and Gaelic football already enjoy widespread viewership. We look forward to enhancing highlights from these sports through Magnifi. By doing so, we can provide fans with the content they need, and Clubber TV in growing the reach and revenue of their coverage,” said Vinayak Shrivastava, the CEO of Magnifi. title: Kartik Aaryan appears in Sony Sports Network’s UEFA EURO 2024
article_content: By MediaInfoline May 17, 2024, 12:47 pm 30 days ahead of UEFA EURO 2024, the biggest football festival of the year, Sony Sports Network has launched its blockbuster campaign “Universe Ka Sabse Bada Football Festival of 2024” featuring their brand ambassador for football, Bollywood sensation Kartik Aaryan. The champion can be seen assuming a dual role in the enthralling campaign film which raises the bar of anticipation for the quadrennial tournament. The campaign film which is high on visual effects encapsulates the level of enthusiasm of fans for UEFA EURO 2024 and provides a glimpse of what ‘the biggest footballing event of the universe’ will bring to the table. The film is a visual delight on Indian television and features Kartik Aaryan, who for the first time dons the avatar of an alien from the outer space, intrigued by the celebrations on Earth and decides to join the festival of football. The alien finds his identical self in a human form. The duo then joins hands along with thousands of other fans to celebrate their favourite European teams and players participating in the tournament. To watch the UEFA EURO 2024 campaign film featuring Bollywood Sensation Kartik Aaryan – click here A continental spectacle, UEFA EURO 2024 is one of the most eagerly-awaited sporting events of the year. The competition will feature 8 out of the top 10 FIFA-ranked countries including reigning champions Italy, France, Spain, Portugal, Belgium, England, Netherlands and Croatia vying for the coveted title. Undoubtedly, the best players and coaches, not just in Europe but across the world will be seen in action as international football takes over the mantle from club football for a month. Fan favourites Cristiano Ronaldo, Kylian Mbappe, Harry Kane, Thomas Mueller, Virgil van Dijk, Luka Modric and others will don their national colours, showcase their magic on the pitch and aim for the ultimate prize. The campaign by Sony Sports Network paves way for an exciting month for football fans as the countdown begins for UEFA EURO 2024. Stay tuned for more on the “Universe Ka Sabse Bada Football Festival of 2024” campaign on Sony Sports Network. Link to view campaign film featuring Bollywood Sensation Kartik Aaryan: What makes Euro 2024 the Biggest festival link – https://www.youtube.com/watch? v=RTml9Plh8Xg Rajesh Kaul, Chief Revenue Officer – Distribution & International Business and Head – Sports Business, Sony Pictures Networks India, said, “UEFA EURO is widely celebrated as one of the biggest football tournaments in the world and we are thrilled to collaborate with Kartik Aaryan, our Brand Ambassador for Football on Sony Sports Network, on this extraordinary campaign for this tournament. This kind of a film with a high end scale and special effects for a football tournament has never been seen by Indian audiences with Kartik Aaryan at the helm of it. The film resonates the excitement for the continental spectacle and captures the emotions of the football fans further reaffirming Sony Sports Network’s commitment to bringing the best experience to our viewers.” Kartik Aaryan, Bollywood Superstar & Brand Ambassador for Football on Sony Sports Network, said, “It’s a pleasure to be associated with Sony Sports Network for this amazing campaign for the UEFA EURO which is the biggest footballing event of 2024. Being a football fan, this campaign is particularly close to my heart. I really enjoyed playing an alien for the first time in my life and for this spectacular campaign. The countdown begins for UEFA EURO 2024 which is going to be a fantastic experience for all audiences in India.” Sony Sports Network is the official broadcaster for UEFA EURO 2024 in India. title: Wrestling stars Reetika Hooda, Nisha Dahiya, and Aman Sehrawat
article_content: By MediaInfoline May 28, 2024, 15:32 pm IOS Sports & Entertainment, India’s premier sports talent management company, today announced the signing of three of India’s top wrestling talents – Reetika Hooda, Nisha Dahiya, and Aman Sehrawat, all of whom have secured their spots for the Paris 2024 Olympics. With these latest signings, four of the six qualified Indian wrestlers for the Games, will now be represented by IOS Sports & Entertainment, who already have Anshu Malik(qualified for Paris 2024) and Sonam Malik in their wrestling roster. The onboarding of the three talented grapplers highlight IOS’s commitment to nurturing India’s sporting potential and furthering the country’s ambitions on the global stage. Rahul Trehan, COO, IOS Sports & Entertainment, welcomed the star wrestlers saying, “We are delighted to have Reetika, Nisha, and Aman on board. Their dedication and skills -align perfectly with our vision to elevate the stature of sports in India. We are committed to providing them with the best exposure, resources and support to excel, so that they can solely focus on their training and preparation for the Paris Olympic Games 2024.” Reetika Hooda, the first Indian woman wrestler to win the U23 World Championship, has made significant strides in her wrestling career. She is one of the five Indian women wrestlers to have earned a quota for Paris Olympic Games 2024, besides Anshu and Nisha. Reflecting on her new partnership with IOS, Reetika expressed, “I am excited to join IOS Sports & Entertainment. They have always supported young wrestlers, so signing with them was an easy decision for me.” She added, “With IOS managing the commercial part, I can focus entirely on my training and elevate my performance to reach full potential and compete for the medal at Paris 2024.” Nisha Dahiya, a silver medalist in the 68 kg category at Asian championship 2023, will join her Team India compatriot Reetika Hooda at IOS. Nisha shared her excitement on joining IOS, saying, “associating with IOS Sports & Entertainment means I can concentrate on training and refining my techniques and strategies for the Olympic games in Paris, without having to worry about logistics and other key financial aspects.” Aman Sehrawat, the young 21-year-old talent, will be the sole male wrestler carrying India’s hopes at the Olympic Games in Paris. His recent performance at the Federation Cup Wrestling Championships 2024, where he reached the finals, underscores his skill and prowess. Aman stated, “With IOS handling the management side, I can dedicate myself entirely to training and enhance my performance to achieve my Olympic dream at Paris 2024. Looking forward to a fruitful and successful association.” IOS Sports & Entertainment remains steadfast in its mission to nurture talent, enhance sports infrastructure, and bring India’s best athleticism and sportsmanship to the global stage. title: Haier India Joins Forces with Star Sports HD as Broadcast
article_content: By MediaInfoline Jun 07, 2024, 15:34 pm Haier Appliances India, the No. 1 global major appliances brand for 15 consecutive years, announces its association with Star Sports HD as the Broadcast Sponsor for the prestigious ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, one of the biggest global sporting events. This collaboration allows Haier India to gain significant visibility during matches broadcasted on Star Sports HD as the global cricket action unfolds with the matches between the US and West Indies teams from June 1 to June 29. Haier India recognizes the significant impact of sports, particularly the unifying zeal of cricket in India, which brings together people from diverse backgrounds. Understanding this opportunity, the brand aims to deepen its connection with millions of cricket enthusiasts and fans by strategically integrating its brand into the digital landscape. Driven by the youth and leveraging new-age marketing strategies, the brand focuses on high-impact sports marketing to strengthen customer connections, build brand awareness, enhance brand loyalty, and drive business growth in the Indian market. Commenting on the exciting collaboration, Mr. NS Satish, President, Haier Appliances India , said, “Cricket is not just a sport; it’s an emotion deeply embedded in the hearts of every Indian. At Haier India, we are thrilled to announce our association as the ‘Broadcast Sponsor’ for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 on Star Sports HD.
